questions: When should exercise testing be performed in stable STEMI patients who are not selected for cardiac catheterization?
Which imaging modalities should be added to exercise testing when baseline ECG abnormalities limit interpretation?
What early physical activity recommendation is given for STEMI patients who are hemodynamically stable?
What dietary approach is recommended for STEMI patients after discharge?
When should patient counseling to improve adherence to post-STEMI treatment begin and how long should it continue?
answers: Exercise testing should be performed either in the hospital or early after discharge in STEMI patients without high-risk features to assess ischemia.
Echocardiography or myocardial perfusion imaging should be added when baseline ECG abnormalities compromise interpretation.
Patients should not remain on bed rest for more than 12-24 hours if they have no recurrent ischemia, heart failure, or serious arrhythmias.
The NCEP ATP III Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes diet with reduced saturated fat and cholesterol intake is recommended.
Counseling should begin early during hospitalization, be reinforced at discharge, and continue at follow-up and rehabilitation sessions.
